alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Chaves County; Southwest Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 01 at 2:20PM MDT until April 04 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northeast, southeast, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...From Monday evening through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Localized areas of blowing dust may restrict visibility.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
